name: sequela
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a result or condition that follows from a disease or illness: neurological sequelae Mild cognitive impairment is a sequela of having multiple concussions while playing football. Most cases are probably a sequel of acute inflammation and do not indicate any specific disease.
More examplesFewer examplesHe received treatment to provide him with better mechanisms to cope with the sequelae of the stroke.Sequelae may become apparent late in the course of what appears to be a successful recovery.The journal is devoted to cardiovascular issues affecting people with the sequels of heart disease acquired in childhood.
